description: Verify that the System Logs page loads correctly with admin authentication
scenario: Admin user navigates to the System Logs page to view and monitor system activity
expected_results: Display the complete System Logs page with header, filter controls, log type selection, and data table with pagination
procedure:
1. Login as admin user with valid credentials
2. Navigate to /admin/logs
3. Verify page loads completely
4. Check that header shows 'Logs' title with file icon
5. Verify all main sections are visible (header, filters, table, pagination)

description: Verify that non-admin users cannot access the System Logs page
scenario: Regular user attempts to access the System Logs page without admin privileges
expected_results: User should be redirected to login page or receive access denied message
procedure:
1. Login as regular user (non-admin)
2. Attempt to navigate to /admin/logs
3. Verify access is denied
4. Check redirect behavior
5. Confirm proper error handling

description: Verify that the logs system handles database errors gracefully
scenario: Admin accesses logs when database connectivity issues occur
expected_results: Appropriate error messages display when database is unavailable, with graceful fallback behavior
procedure:
1. Simulate database unavailability
2. Access logs page
3. Verify appropriate error message displays
4. Check redirect to admin dashboard occurs
5. Confirm no sensitive error information is exposed

description: Verify that appropriate empty state messages display when no log data is available
scenario: Admin views log types that have no data or filters that return no results
expected_results: Display appropriate empty state message with helpful icon and descriptive text
procedure:
1. View log type with no data (Email Verifications)
2. Verify empty state message displays
3. Check icon and messaging are appropriate
4. Verify styling matches design system
5. Test empty state for all log types when applicable

description: Verify that the System Logs page displays correctly on different screen sizes
scenario: Admin accesses the logs page on various devices and screen resolutions
expected_results: Page layout adapts appropriately with responsive table design, hidden columns on mobile, and proper text sizing
procedure:
1. Access page on desktop (1920x1080)
2. Resize browser window to tablet size (768px)
3. Test on mobile viewport (375px)
4. Verify table columns hide appropriately on smaller screens
5. Check that all content remains accessible and readable
